current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text: To apply laws that restrict the political speech of American citizens to media corporations.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

committee-name.#text: Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Application of laws that restrict the political speech of American citizens to media corporations

text.#text:
Any law that restricts the political speech of American citizens shall apply with equal force to
			 media corporations, such as the New York Times, the American Broadcasting
			 Company (ABC), the National Broadcasting Company (NBC), and the CBS
			 Television Network.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is found
			 unconstitutional, such law shall have no force or effect with respect to
			 American citizens.

text.#text: To the extent that the application of a law to a media corporation under

header.#text: No application to American citizens  if application to media corporations found unconstitutional

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 S2416 IS: Free All Speech Act of 2014
